channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown vegetation, 9th May
item.description:
Brambles hanging over the route used by many particularly parents and children going to school. Also drug users debris along the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Willersey Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: A40 Golden Valley Eastbound Elmbridge Court roundabout to marker post 164/3, 9th May
item.description:
ACO Kerbs along this section are blocked due to a lot of silt and weeds. I am a Highways Inspector for National Highways I've been made aware Tewkesbury Council are responsible for sweeping along this section we need this sweeping so we can clean the ACO kerbs, in heavy rain this is causing flooding into live lane, do you have a sweeping programme for this as I've never seen it swept?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple problems with the carriageway surface, 8th May
item.description:
Should l laugh or cry. I noticed new paint for the carriageway markings on this roundabout, whilst the carriageway surface is shot to pieces. What a waste of time and tax payers money. This whole junction needs digging up and reconstructing, then new markings applied. ITS A TOTAL JOKE.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole outside the entrance to Rushworth House, 8th May
item.description:
Right at the entrance of Rushworth house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Rushworth Close, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sheer drop at roadside Dangerous, longstanding Issue, 8th May
item.description:
On Green Lane on right side as approach entrance to retirement park. Cables installed by broadband company visible in base. Apparently 2 quotes received for repairs by council but too costly (email received with this info.) Please update when this will be rectified as fast moving vehicles and large wagons may end up having an accident here, or horses or pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pedestrian lights stay on red (for traffic) for too long after pedestrians have crossed, 8th May
item.description:
Pedestrian lights opposite Coronation Cafe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4-5, Princess Elizabeth Way, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead branches of tree keep falling onto pavement, driveway, car, with plenty more to come, 8th May
item.description:
Big oak tree on pavement outside 290/292 Hatherley Road The tree is dropping rather large branches. Plenty more dead branches in the tree. Would be good to cut them off before they cause damage or hit a child on the school run.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 292, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp bend sign - still dangerously obscured, 8th May
item.description:
Thank you for attending yesterday and cutting back some of the vegetation but I’m afraid to say one of the sharp bend signs is still dangerously obscured. I have attached a photo that shows the view from a motorist’s point of view approaching the bend. i.e. the sign is still largely hidden and vegetation needs to be cut back much further. Location: ///double.basic.pile https://w3w.co/double.basic.pile

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No entry sign, 8th May
item.description:
We have just moved into No.1 Camberley Close, Hucclecote, Gloucester GL3 3PQ The bungalow has been extended and the no entry sign is in line with our drive, causing difficulty in parking on the drive. I was hoping it could be moved out of line with our driveway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberley Close, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Ongoing Potholes Near National Star - Never Permanently Fixed, 8th May
item.description:
There are countless potholes which are never permanently fixed. Just patches upon patches. It goes on in two separate areas. One area for around a metre. The next area for around two metres. It causes drivers to drive in the middle of the road. Not safe. It is a hazard. The same attention should be given as to speeding and fining the public as well as giving points to drivers imminently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road markings, lines and stud issues problem, 8th May
item.description:
Please can junction lines be refreshed thanks
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 8th May
item.description:
Speed limit sign knocked over during cycleway construction. Please pass on to AHR for the area to arrange reinstatement.
Report on FixMyStreet
